section.title: The Bargin
section.p: Seeing the queen’s distress, the little man decided to offer her one last chance. He told her that if she could guess his name within three days, she would be able to keep her child. However, if she failed, the child would be his forever. The queen felt a glimmer small bit of hope at this new bargain, determined to keep her beloved child no matter the cost. She knew she would have to guess carefully and try every name she could think of.

section.title: The First Two Days
section.p: For two days, the queen tried every name she could recall, from the common to the unusual and exotic strange. She sent messengers far and wide to gather new names, determined to uncover the little man’s secret. But with each guess, the little man only shook his head with a grin and told her she was wrong. The queen felt her hope fading as the final day approached.

section.title: The Revelation
section.p: Late on the second evening, a messenger returned with surprising news. While wandering in the forest, he had heard a strange little man dancing around a fire, singing about how the queen would never guess his name, for it was Rumpelstiltskin. The queen felt a surge of relief was overjoyed at this discovery, finally knowing the name that had been hidden from her. She knew now that her child would be safe, as long as she revealed it to him in time.
